messages.content: When drying cloths in the sun it takes 3 hours for 6 t-shirts. How long will it take to dry 30 t-shirts?
It will take 3 hours/6 t-shirts = 50 minutes to dry 30 t-shirts.
what concept is used in the question?

The concept used in the question is multiplication. The question is asking how long it will take to dry 30 t-shirts if it takes 3 hours and 6 t-shirts to dry in that time. The problem can be represented as 3 hours \* 30 t-shirts = 90 minutes, or 90 minutes per t-shirt.
I have a clothing line that can hold 100 t-shirts how many hours does it take to dry all t-shirts

To determine how many hours it takes to dry all 100 t-shirts, we need to know how long it takes to dry one t-shirt. If it takes 3 hours to dry 6 t-shirts, it would take 3 hours/6 t-shirts = 50 minutes to dry one t-shirt.

Since you have a clothing line that can hold 100 t-shirts, it would take 100 t-shirts/50 minutes = 2 t-shirts to dry in 1 hour. This means it would take 2 hours to dry all 100 t-shirts.
